com.cmput301w20t10.uberapp.database.base

Class DAOBase<Entity extends EntityBase,Model extends ModelBase>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cmput301w20t10.uberapp.database.base.DAOBase<Entity,Model>
  • Type Parameters:
    Entity - Entities are the one-to-one representation of objects to the database
    Model - Models are application objects that front end programmers get to interact with
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DriverDAO, RiderDAO, RideRequestDAO, TransactionDAO, UserDAO

    public abstract class DAOBase<Entity extends EntityBase,Model extends ModelBase>
extends java.lang.Object
    Base class for DAO's that handle read and writing for models and entities

    • Method Detail

      • saveEntity

        public androidx.lifecycle.MutableLiveData<java.lang.Boolean> saveEntity(Entity entity)
        Saves all dirty fields for a given entity. Dirty fields in an entity are unsaved fields. DatabaseObjectBase detects these changes. It is not encouraged to use this in classes outside the database folder.

        Parameters:
        entity - Entity to update
        Returns:
        MutableLiveData that views can observe to know whether saving was successful or not
        See Also:
        DatabaseObjectBase

      • saveModel

        public abstract androidx.lifecycle.MutableLiveData<java.lang.Boolean> saveModel(Model model)
        Saves all dirty fields for a given model. Dirty fields in an entity are unsaved fields. DatabaseObjectBase detects these changes. This is the method that's encouraged to use to update your models. To update your models: 

             Rider rider;

     ...
     // code that changes your rider such as
     rider.setImage("new image");
     ...

     MutableLiveData liveData = RiderDAO.getDAO();
     liveData.observe(lifecycleOwner, riderDAO -> {
         if (riderDAO != null) {
              // it is recommended that you keep your riderDAO as a local variable
              // once you have verified that riderDAO is null
              riderDAO.saveModel(rider)
                  .observe(...);
         } else {
              // error handling here
              // it is likely that the user was not logged in
              // or the user was logged out by the system
         }
     });
        Parameters:
        model - Model to update
        Returns:
        MutableLiveData that views can observe to know whether saving was successful or not

      • getCollectionName

        protected abstract java.lang.String getCollectionName()
        Get Firestore Collection name associated with the DAO. This is used for a code in DAOBAse. On the subclass, simply put: 
             protected String getCollectionName() {
         return COLLECTION; // where COLLECTION is a static final String
     }
        Returns:
        COLLECTION String representing the collection name in Firestore

      • getModelByID

        public androidx.lifecycle.MutableLiveData<Model> getModelByID(java.lang.String docId)
        Gets the Model object equivalent for a given String docId.

        Usage: 

             // UserDao extends DaoBase
     UserDAO dao = new UserDAO();
     MutableLiveData liveData = dao.getModelbyId(docId);
     liveData.observe(this, user -> {
         if (user != null) {
             // do something with model
         } else {
             // no internet connection; handle this case here
         }
     });
        Parameters:
        docId - String object representing the path or document ID of the data in Firestore
        Returns:
        liveData MutableLiveData that may receive a Model equivalent object or a null object when something went wrong

      • getModelByReference

        public androidx.lifecycle.MutableLiveData<Model> getModelByReference(com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentReference documentReference)
        Gets the Model object equivalent for a given .

        Usage: 

             // UserDao extends DaoBase
     UserDAO dao = new UserDAO();
     MutableLiveData liveData = dao.getModelbyId(documentReference);
     liveData.observe(this, user -> {
         if (user != null) {
             // do something with model
         } else {
             // no internet connection; handle this case here
         }
     });
        Parameters:
        documentReference - DocumentReference referencing a document in Firestore
        Returns:
        liveData MutableLiveData that may receive a Model equivalent object or a null object when something went wrong

      • getEntityByID

        public androidx.lifecycle.MutableLiveData<Entity> getEntityByID(java.lang.String docId)
        Gets the Entity object equivalent for a given String docId. This is not recommended for usage for classes not in the database folder.
        Parameters:
        docId - String object representing the path or document ID of the data in Firestore
        Returns:
        liveData MutableLiveData that may receive an Entity equivalent object or a null object when something went wrong

      • getEntityByReference

        public androidx.lifecycle.MutableLiveData<Entity> getEntityByReference(com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentReference documentReference)
        Gets the Entity object equivalent for a given String docId. This is not recommended for usage for classes not in the database folder.
        Parameters:
        documentReference - DocumentReference for the document in Firestore
        Returns:
        liveData MutableLiveData that may receive an Entity equivalent object or a null object when something went wrong

      • create

        protected abstract DAOBase<Entity,Model> create()
        Template code needed for code in DAOBase. Override with: 
             // UserDAO extends DAOBase
     return new UserDAO();
        Returns:
        DAOBase initialized using new under its subclass

      • createModelFromEntity

        protected abstract androidx.lifecycle.MutableLiveData<Model> createModelFromEntity(Entity entity)
        Follows the pattern: 
        return new Model(entity);
        Some Models require several entities so some methods would expect: 
        return new Model(entity, otherEntityList.get(0))
        Parameters:
        entity - Entity
        Returns:
        Model

      • createObjectFromSnapshot

        protected abstract Entity createObjectFromSnapshot(com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentSnapshot snapshot)
        Follows the pattern: 
        snapshot.toObject(Entity.class)
        Parameters:
        snapshot -
        Returns:
        Entity

                                Entity mainEntity)
        Override only if Model requires more than one Entity.
        Parameters:

        mainEntity -
